text:
Hi.

According to the documentation ProxyErrorOverride should work in directory context (which is reasonable).

But when put inside <Location>... apache fails starting.


Cheers,
Chris.
creator: calestyo@scientia.net
mike.rumph@oracle.com
text:
Hello Christoph,

Apache httpd trunk is starting okay for me on Linux with the following simple set of directives:

<Location /status>
  SetHandler server-status
  ProxyErrorOverride On
</Location>

Do you have some specific set of directives that are failing?

Thanks,

Mike Rumph

creator: calestyo@scientia.net
text:
Hey.

It seems I've overseen here that it works with 2.4 and only not with 2.2.

Marking it for 2.2.22.

Given that 2.2 runs out, you can close that IMHO.


Cheers,
Chris.

creator: mike.rumph@oracle.com
text:
Hello Chris,

The ProxyErrorOverride directive was changed to per directory scope in Apache httpd 2.3.8 by r1025666.

This is a documented change between httpd 2.2 and 2.4:
- http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.2/mod/mod_proxy.html#proxyerroroverride 
- http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/mod_proxy.html#proxyerroroverride 

So I am marking this as working as intended.

Take care,

Mike Rumph
